main: ^Question: Regular physical activity can improve your mood by triggering endorphins.
^This health benefit is supported by many studies from the World Health Organization (WHO). (Press 'Space' to choose)
answer: ^Regular exercise is associated with release of endorphins,
^which are neurotransmitters that act as natural painkillers and mood elevators.
^The World Health Organization (WHO) recognizes the positive impact of regular physical activity on mental well-being.
^Several studies support the idea that exercise can contribute to improved mood and overall mental health.
